author: 界面新闻
title: 当县城柜员还有希望吗？银行春招进行时：岗位缩减、与大厂"抢"科技人才 _ 东方财富网
text:
界面新闻记者 | 何柳颖
　　 银行 春招正马不停蹄进行中。
　　3月26日， 中国银行 表示，2025年春季招聘和实习生招聘笔试即将开启。在此之前，工农中建四大行均发布了春招公告。
　　然而，部分公告让应聘者感到措手不及。“这次春招人数缩减这么多，报县城柜员是不是没希望了！”有应聘者在社交媒体上着急地提问。
　　对比去年春招，今年四大行春招规模均出现缩减，其中农行大幅缩减约1万个岗位，工行也接近“砍半”。受访专家认为， 银行 主要出于人力成本、数字化转型等因素调整校招规模。
　　从岗位类型看，业务岗与科技岗仍是招聘核心。围绕科技岗，多家 银行 给出了具体的职业发展路径，可走管理序列，也可走专业序列，无论哪条路径，“金融+科技”配置的复合型人才都是银行的培养主力。
　　从应聘者的角度出发，银行的科技岗给到的薪资待遇、技术钻研机会等不及大厂，但胜在平台稳定，这还是吸引了不少科技人才。待遇方面，有业内人士称，对于特别优秀的高精尖人才，“一事一议”亦属常理。
　　 农行春招缩减万人岗位
　　2025年，四大行春招规模均有所缩小。
　　据银行招聘网统计，2025 农业银行 春招拟招4500人，去年春招人数约14500人，大幅缩减约1万人；中国 工商银行 春季校园招聘拟招4500人，去年春招人数约8600人； 中国银行 今年春招约4700人，去年约5700人；中国 建设银行 今年拟招2300人，去年约3700人。
　　作为参考，在2025年秋招（秋招通常在上年10月左右启动）中，工农中建四大行的招聘人数与2024年秋招相当。
　　对比两年春招公告可以发现，农行缩减的1万个招聘岗位分散在各分行。比如农行北京分行今年春招拟招80人，而去年春招人数为400人。结合秋招情况来看，整体招聘同样缩水，今年秋招拟招350人，去年人数为 560人。这意味着，该分行今年校园招聘人数不足去年的一半。
　　同时，对比农行北京分行招聘岗位可以发现，相较于秋招，缩减主要出现在分行本部岗位，包括科技岗和业务岗，而支行业务类岗位仍在招录。另一方面，该分行今年春招新设置了“信息科技岗”，该岗位录用毕业生入职分行后，先安排3年培养锻炼（分支行轮岗），同时作为总行审计储备生，培养期满后可择优遴选至总行驻当地审计分局工作。
　　另外，部分银行分支机构并无参与本轮春招。比如工行的39家分行机构中，仅23家分支机构开放春招渠道，有16家分行没有开放春招渠道。
　　苏商银行特约研究员武泽伟向界面新闻记者表示，四大行春招规模缩减主要有以下原因，一是目前银行普遍面临息差收窄、利润承压等问题，控制人力成本成为重要手段；二是随着数字化转型加速，传统线下网点业务需求下降，线上服务替代率提升，导致基层岗位需求减少；三是科技投入优先级提升，资源更多向信息科技、数据治理等领域倾斜，压缩传统岗位编制以支持战略转型。
　　 “我们要一线业务岗与金融科技岗”
　　有城商行内部人士告诉界面新闻记者，目前其所在行需要的员工集中在一线业务岗、服务岗以及金融科技人才。
　　上述人士认为，与互联网大厂相比，部分银行存在架构不清、人员臃肿的问题，尤其是只传递不承担经营压力的中层管理人员。
　　其称，“银行的层级很多，不像互联网那样扁平化，而伴随着 人工智能 的发展，这部分的管理可以通过科技提升。比如合同检验、会议纪要等工作，这部分人员其实已经高于实际需求。”
　　在该名人士看来，着眼整个银行业，目前的人才缺口主要集中在一线营销类、服务类和科技类。
　　“营销类人才之所以重要，是因为银行的产品同质化严重，要让客户了解、购买产品，以及产品售后，这些其实还是需要人为触发。柜员工作也会长期需要，因为总有需要到网点处理业务的客户。科技类则是需要满足银行的整体数字化转型需求，这代表着银行与未来的接轨。”该人士分析称。
　　今年的银行春招方向显示出这一趋势。 建设银行 分行招聘岗位基本集中在科技类专项人才、综合营销岗与柜面服务岗。其中综合营销岗主要从事客户服务、柜面服务及业务营销等工作。新员工入职后，先在基层网点柜员等岗位进行培养锻炼，根据个人表现及工作需要，聘任至营业网点或其他机构相关岗位。
　　图源： 建设银行 官网
　　在 中国银行 2025年春招中，境内分行共招聘三类人才，分别为信息科技岗、营业网点业务岗位（营销服务）、营业网点业务岗位（综合服务）。 成都银行 春招公告亦显示，面向2025年度应届生公开招聘总行金融科技岗、分支行柜面业务岗。
　　对于基层业务岗，业内人士认为，在数字化转型的大背景下，如今的趋势是“长期需求减少，短期缺人”。
　　而科技类人才仍是本轮校园招聘的重点对象。“当前，随着 人工智能 等新技术加速渗透，银行更加注重科技型人才和复合型人才，表现在招聘上，一方面，科技类岗位需求爆发式增长，银行将大量招聘名额向信息科技岗等相关岗位倾斜，另一方面，复合型人才备受公司青睐，既懂金融业务又熟悉技术的‘金融科技人才’招聘比例显著上升。”武泽伟表示。
　　 平安银行 2025年春招分为“金融专场”与“科技专场”，后者服务于 平安银行 金融科技部校招生培养计划，主要招聘后端开发岗、算法岗人才，通过技术能力、金融业务以及成长导师辅导专项培养，“金融+科技”双重属性打造复合型金融科技人才。
　　平安集团首席科学家兼平安科技常务副总经理肖京近日提及，在金融科技的人才队伍上，平安集团从十多年前开始一直在进行建设。这段时间平安正在进行新一轮的校招，我们也把招聘重点聚焦在 人工智能 大数据 岗位。
　　如武泽伟所言，在银行体系内，“金融+科技”配置的复合型人才是培养主力。如工行的平台金融发展中心的研发经理岗，其目标定位正是“成为新技术研究、应用研发、系统开发等领域金融科技专业人才”。
　　部分银行为科技类岗位提供了明确的职业发展路径。桂林银行推出了培养金融科技管 培生 的“匠星计划”，该项目培养周期原则上为2年，包括轮岗期1年，跟踪培养期1年，其中轮岗期分为系统开发学习、运营维护学习、 网络安全 学习三个阶段。若走管理序列，晋升路径为员工-经理-中层干部-高管；若走专业序列，晋升路径为初级-中级-高级-资深-专家。
　　另有银行在招聘中提及，应聘者有机会走上“从分行到总行”的学习通道。 建设银行 表示，对于一级分行的科技类专项人才，新员工入职后，有机会安排至分行金融科技部，或总行运营 数据中心 、金融科技子公司（含各事业群）等机构岗学习。
　　值得注意的是，伴随着近几年科技人才的陆续增员，部分机构对此类人才需求已有所减少。比如中国 工商银行 平台金融发展中心近年积极招揽研发经理、产品经理方向的科技菁英，不过招聘人数已从2024年春秋招的75人缩减至今年春秋招的50人。
　　界面新闻记者还留意到，相较于校园招聘，银行在社会招聘中对科技人才的要求更为具体、细化。如 建设银行 面向社会招聘“零售业务人工智能应用专家”，该岗位将负责零售业务人工智能创新应用并推动落地；负责零售业务智能工具的运营及迭代，打造敏捷响应、高效迭代的线上运营机制等。对应地，应聘要求也相对严苛，要求具有5年以上人工智能领域工作经验，其中至少3年金融行业或金融科技公司从事人工智能相关工作。
　　 和大厂抢人？
　　值得指出的是，科技人才是各行各业的香饽饽，银行在抢人方面并不具备绝对优势。
　　上述银行人士告诉记者，在银行，科技类人才接触更多的是应用层面的探索，而非极其前沿的技术研究。因此，对于潜心前沿技术的应聘者而言，银行的岗位吸引力不及大厂。
　　“薪酬方面，我们一般是在银行新员工薪酬以及这个岗位的市场化价值之间取一个值，银行一般很难完全按照市场化标准来确定薪酬，当然，一事一议，部分岗位对于人才的迫切程度可以支撑起高薪。”该名人士称。
　　这或许可以从社会招聘中得以一窥。 成都银行 近日发布了一则总行高层次人才社会招聘公告，其中总行信息技术部总经理助理（人工智能方向）以及总行风险管理部总经理助理（互联网金融风险模型方向）各招1人，薪资均达到70-80万元/年，特别优秀者可视情况“一事一议”。
　　当然，门槛也很高。人工智能方向要求8年以上人工智能或计算机领域工作经验，并具有相应层级以上领导管理岗位工作经历；互联网化金融风险模型方向要求5年以上头部互联网金融平台工作经验，并具有相应层级以上领导管理岗位工作经历。
　　普遍而言，银行的科技人才待遇不及大厂，应聘者对此亦很清楚。“大厂可以开出比银行高很多的薪资，接触的工作内容也更复杂，更具有成长性，视野也会更开阔。银行科技岗则以稳定性为主，工作强度低很多，但相应的待遇也会差一些。”张同学告诉界面新闻记者，作为新加坡国立大学人工智能系统专业的应届生，他在上一轮秋招中参加了多家银行的金融科技岗面试。
　　“大厂以及银行等央国企，这是两个不同的发展方向，我个人还是倾向于稳定性。”张同学表示。
　　从职业发展看，银行与大厂的路径也不一样。“银行是业务导向，信息技术岗在其中更多是作为支持性工作。在面试过程中，技术是一方面，更重要的是要对自己之前的实习和参与的项目有深度思考，面试官也会更在意面试者是否对自己的研究或工作的实际应用价值有相关思考，比如是否对银行的业务发展有实质性的帮助。”张同学称。
　　当然，“这并不是说技术不重要，技术是信息科技岗的根本，依然是面试中最重要的一个基础。”张同学补充称。
　　待遇、职业路径、平台情况，这些都是科技人才的考虑因素。“我的求职方向是国央企的信息科技及算法岗，主要在意工资待遇、工作内容是否符合兴趣、平台发展和稳定性，会综合考虑这几方面。”张同学表示。
　　当下，他仍在考虑是否要入职银行科技岗，“也许最后会舍掉银行，入职其他国企”。
（文章来源：界面新闻）

author: Naasir Akailvi
title: MN woman alleges dentist applied 20 restorations in single visit | kare11.com
text: MINNEAPOLIS — A Minnesota woman is suing her former dentist for more than $50,000 after he allegedly attempted a dizzying array of dental procedures in a single visit. Kathleen Wilson filed a lawsuit against Dr. Kevin Molldrem and Molldrem Family Dentristy alleging that she continues to experience pain, suffering, emotional distress and disfigurement after Molldrem attempted to give her four root canals, eight crowns and 20 restorations in a single visit back in 2020. According to Dr. Avrum Goldstein, a Florida dentist retained by Wilson's legal team, Molldrem "may have come close" to having the correct diagnosis, but provided the wrong treatment and poor quality treatment. Wilson had decay or tooth dissolution on "virtually every tooth in her mouth", a rare issue, according to Goldstein. "Katie required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease. Trying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner," wrote Goldstein in his report. The lawsuit also alleges Molldrem failed to create a care plan that would effectively address decay and tooth dissolution and provided quantities of anesthesia well in excess of recommended doses. More than a year after her last visit with Molldrem, a different dentist, Dr. Tim Isaacson saw Wilson and noted that of the 28 teeth restored by Molldrem, 27 of them had signs of decay, sometimes on multiple surfaces or adverse contours. KARE 11 reached out to the Eden Prairie-based Molldrem Family Dentistry and has not heard back as of publication. The KARE 11+ app includes live streams of all of KARE 11's newscasts. You'll also find on-demand replays of newscasts; the latest from KARE 11 Investigates, Breaking the News and the Land of 10,000 Stories; exclusive programs like Verify and HeartThreads; and Minnesota sports talk from our partners at Locked On Minnesota. [Add KARE 11+ on Roku here](https://channelstore.roku.com/details/06858323301242c7f28c2f819d0a2004/kare-11-news-from-minneapolis)or by searching for KARE 11 in the Roku Channel Store. author: Lisa Rapaport. Fact-Checked
title: Are Antidepressants as Dangerous as RFK Jr. Claims? - NewsBreak
text: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the newly confirmed secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) , says he wants to assess whether it's truly safe and effective for millions of Americans to take certain antidepressants and other prescription drugs to manage mental health conditions. He has a broad mandate to do this as HHS secretary and head of the Make America Healthy Again (MAHA) Commission that President Donald Trump established with an executive order last week. Here's what health experts have to say about the concerns Kennedy has raised regarding antidepressants. During his confirmation hearings, Kennedy suggested that antidepressants could be even more addictive than heroin. While people can experience withdrawal symptoms from abruptly stopping treatment with antidepressants, these medicines aren't habit forming, says Ragy Girgis, MD , a clinical psychiatry professor at Columbia University. "SSRIs have no addictive potential, while heroin is one of the most addictive substances known to humankind," Dr. Girgis says. Abruptly halting treatment with SSRIs can cause flu-like symptoms, restlessness, insomnia , anxiety, and an upset stomach, says Colin Davidson, PhD , a neuropharmacologist at the University of Central Lancashire in England. "Abrupt withdrawal from heroin will likely cause drug cravings, anxiety, nausea, diarrhea, stomach cramps, fever, sweating, and increased heart rate and blood pressure," Dr. Davidson says. Compared with withdrawal from antidepressants, he notes, "Withdrawal from heroin tends to be much worse." People taking antidepressants can minimize withdrawal symptoms by working with their doctor to gradually reduce their dose when they want to discontinue treatment, Girgis says. But the overall risk of suicide among young people is low, Davidson says. About 1 percent of teens may experience suicidal thoughts or behaviors at some point during adolescence, Davidson says, and this risk rises to about 2 percent of teens who are taking antidepressants. This doesn't mean, however, that the medicines make people suicidal, Girgis says. Suicidal thoughts can be caused by the underlying mental heath issues that lead people to take antidepressants. "When people are very depressed and want to take their own life, they will not report suicidality," Girgis says. This changes when they start taking antidepressants, Girgis explains. "When people begin taking SSRIs, they improve - their mood, energy, and willingness to engage increase. They are less likely to want to take their life and more likely to want help. Because of all these factors, they begin reporting their suicidal ideation. Therefore, while it appears that SSRIs ‘cause' suicidal ideation, they do not actually cause suicidal ideation." But evidence doesn't support this claim. "Antidepressants, in rare cases, can cause intense inner restlessness, emotional blunting, mania, and psychosis, all of which could contribute to violence," Davidson says. But this is rare, and it doesn't mean the medicines directly cause shootings. "There is no evidence to suggest that antidepressants, or any psychiatric medications, play a role in mass shootings or homicide, and the black box warning has nothing to do with violence or homicidality," Girgis says.

author: sina.com.cn
title: 买手机送充电宝，vivo Y300 Pro+反向充电实测|充电宝|vivo_新浪科技_新浪网
text:
在手机续航焦虑普遍存在的当下，vivo Y300 Pro+以“续航灭霸”的姿态横空出世，其搭载的7300mAh超薄蓝海电池堪称同档机型中的能量巨兽。但这款手机的续航+倍实力远不止于此——支持反向充电功能，让手机秒变充电宝，其反向充电功率更是达到了7.5W。
Y300 Pro+的反向充电功能，首先得益于其堪称“恐怖”的电池配置。虽然电池容量大，通过第三代硅负极材料与钴酸锂正极的组合，电池能量密度提升至838Wh/L，在保持7.89mm超薄机身的同时，实现了比前代多800mAh的容量突破。这意味着手机本身就是一块“巨型充电宝”，即使在为其他设备供电时，也能保留充足电量应对自身需求。
如何使用反向充电呢？只需在设置中打开OTG功能，用数据线连接待充电设备，手机即可自动切换为供电模式。
实测中，使用Y300 Pro+为支持OTG协议的蓝牙耳机充电，30分钟内可将耳机电量从10%充至60%，充电效率远超普通充电宝。
Y300 Pro+的稳定输出为iPhone16充电，30分钟可充入15%电量，足以支撑紧急通话或扫码支付。
反向充电在会议室临时需要为无线麦克风、投影仪遥控器充电时，Y300 Pro+无需额外设备即可解决问题。甚至在笔记本电脑续航告急时，通过Type-C接口可为支持PD协议轻薄本提供临时供电。
与同档机型相比，7.5W的反向充电功率使vivo Y300 Pro+具备明显优势。无论是安卓阵营的耳机、手环，还是苹果的智能设备，甚至是支持OTG的小型平板，均可通过Type-C数据线连接实现充电。
此外，Y300 Pro+还支持多种快充协议，不仅自身充电兼容性强，反向充电时也能更好地适配不同设备，提高了使用的便捷性和通用性。
当然，反向充电只是Y300 Pro+续航优势的冰山一角。Y300 Pro+支持PPS、UFCS等多种快充协议，90W超快闪充可在30分钟内充入60%电量，配合超长寿蓝海电池技术，历经1300次循环后电池容量仍能保持80%以上，5年使用无需担心续航衰减。
得益于半固态电解质技术，Y300 Pro+在-20℃低温环境下仍能保持稳定放电。远优于普通手机在低温下的“罢工”表现，北方用户冬季使用也能安心。
此外，低功耗的第三代骁龙7s处理器与OriginOS5的深度优化，让手机本身续航已足够支撑两天一充，反向充电则是锦上添花的“终极保险”。
vivo Y300 Pro+的反向充电功能，并非简单的“附加功能”，无论是应急补电、设备互联还是极端场景，这项功能都展现出强大的实用性。结合7300mAh超大电池、90W闪充与抗寒长寿技术，Y300 Pro+真正实现了“续航+倍”的体验，堪称“买手机送充电宝”的性价比之王。对于注重续航与实用性的用户来说，这款手机不仅是通讯工具，更是移动生活的充电宝。

author: @SutterHealth
title: Nurse is Patient’s Hero for Saving Her Baby’s Life | Vitals
text: Vanessa Miranda-Stewart (right) and her baby Sofia are pictured with Angie Suarez, RN at Sutter Santa Rosa Regional Hospital in March 2024. By Jennifer Modenessi, Vitals contributor One day in early March, Vanessa Miranda-Stewart walked into [Sutter Santa Rosa Regional Hospital](https://www.sutterhealth.org/ssrrh) with her 6-month-old daughter and one very clear goal: to thank the nurse who saved her baby’s life. “I told her you have just filled my heart for the day and month,” said Angie Suarez, registered nurse, recalling Vanessa’s surprise visit to express her gratitude to the antenatal testing unit nurse for her actions last fall. “It warmed my heart and made me feel really good about what I do.” What Angie did on September 12, 2023, is forever etched in Vanessa’s memory. Life-saving Surgery Using her expertise and intuition, Angie advocated for additional prenatal monitoring of her patient that resulted in a critical emergency Cesarean-section for Vanessa and life-saving surgery for Sofia, who was born with esophageal atresia and a tracheoesophageal fistula, a pair of congenital conditions that affect a baby’s ability to eat and breathe. The conditions can occur together during the early weeks of fetal development when the esophagus fails to connect with the mouth and stomach and separate from the trachea. The conditions are undetectable until birth. “Sofia might not realistically be here if it wasn’t for Angie,” Vanessa said. When Vanessa went in for monitoring last September, she was nearly 34 weeks pregnant with a much-anticipated baby conceived via in vitro fertilization. The pregnancy was smooth but at 32 weeks an anatomy scan had revealed the baby’s abdomen was measuring slightly smaller in proportion to the rest of her body. Frequent stress tests, doppler scans, and additional monitoring at the hospital labor and delivery department followed. The goal, Vanessa recalled, was to get to at least 36 weeks of pregnancy to reduce any possible complications to mom and baby from an early delivery. Still, she had a gut feeling that something was off. “A part of me knew that we weren’t going to get there,” Vanessa said. Instinct and Observation At her morning monitoring appointment with nurse Angie, Vanessa felt fine, but her baby was showing signs of stress. “I watched her baby that day and it didn’t look normal to me,” Angie recalled. The baby’s heart rate took intermittent dips and her movements slowed. Based on her assessment, Angie advocated for Vanessa to remain a little longer for additional monitoring. “I wasn’t ready to let her go,” Angie said. The nurse’s instinct proved to be lifesaving. As Angie continued monitoring, the baby’s heart rate took more dips. “The baby was just going downhill, and the heart rate was looking worse and worse,” she recalled. “The baby was telling us ‘I’m in distress.’ We didn’t know why.” Personal Hero Vanessa was moved to labor and delivery for observation. She delivered baby Sofia that evening via emergency C-section. A short while later, Sofia was transported to another hospital in Oakland and underwent a successful six-hour surgery to correct the rare anomalies affecting her digestive system. Today, baby Sofia is happy and healthy, which is something Vanessa and her husband credit to the medical teams at Sutter Health and the Oakland hospital – but most of all to Angie. “To me, Angie saved Sofia’s life just by keeping us 20 to 30 minutes,” Vanessa said. “She’s our personal hero.”

author: San Diego Living
title: Powering a Brighter San Diego | San Diego Community Power Leads Our Region on Path to 100% Renewable Energy | cbs8.com
text: SAN DIEGO — San Diego Community Power is flipping the switch on the energy marketplace, delivering cleaner and more affordable electricity to nearly a million customers in San Diego County. CEO Karin Burns joins our Laura Cavanaugh to share how SDCP is leading the region in green solutions for a brighter future. As San Diego’s locally run, not-for-profit electricity provider, San Diego Community Power is on a mission to procure 100 percent clean and renewable energy by the year 2035 or sooner, and to do so in a way that is equitable, affordable and sustainable. “We started in 2019. We served our first customer in 2021. And today we’re serving over one million customer meters across San Diego,” said Burns. “The way it works is we buy solar, wind, geothermal. We buy those resources from power developers. We send that energy through the poles and wires of SDG&E. And then the customer receives one bill that includes our portion and the portion of SDG&E.” SDCP serves nearly one million customers in San Diego, Chula Vista, Encinitas, Imperial Beach, National City, La Mesa and the unincorporated County of San Diego. Utility and electricity rates impact us all in San Diego. That is why San Diego Community Power is working to keep costs down for customers. “This year our board approved our recommendation to reduce our rates by 18 percent compared to last year,” said Burns. “And entering into partnerships with groups like Ohm Connect, we’re working on launching programs that will help folks use less energy that will help them shift energy into less expensive, lower cost parts of the day. We’re buying our renewable resources with 20 year power purchase agreements. And that helps reduce costs and stabilize them.” Learn how San Diego Community Power is working for you at www.sdcommunitypower.org Sponsored by: San Diego Community Power

locations.name: san diego community power leads our region
